newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS - Institution exits Informix call.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS - Institution exits Informix call.

text.p: Big trades in an Informix Corp option highlighted trading that was largely focused on the expiration of December contracts.
On the American Stock Exchange, the Informix January 20 call traded about 6,050 contracts. The same option traded about 4,950 contracts on the Chicago Board Options Exchange.
Traders said an institution was selling the calls to exit a position.
"Both times (on the AMEX and CBOE), the crowd took down the calls," a trader at the CBOE said.
He added that the option, which was down 3/4 at two in afternoon trading, traded as low as 1-5/8.
"It seems to me like a big portfolio hedge," he said. "We don't see that type of customer normally unless it's something like that."
Informix shares were down 55/64 at 20-57/64 on turnover of more than 5.6 million shares.
The trader said the stock was under pressure after Soundview Financial cut its earnings estimates for fiscal 1996 and 1997.
In other activity, Conrail Inc options continued active on the Philadelphia Stock Exchange after Thursday's sweetened bid from friendly suitor CSX Corp.
The new bid remains below the hostile offer from Norfolk Southern Co.
Among the options, the January 105 call was most active, with about 5,435 contracts changing hands by afternoon. With the stock moving away from that strike price, the option lost 3/8 to 3/4.
The Conrail January 100 call traded 2,850 contracts and fell 3/4 to 2-1/2.
The Conrail December 100 call, which expires today, traded 2,260 contracts. It lost 1-1/8 to 1/8.
Conrail shares, up Thursday on the revised bid, slipped 3/4 to 100 on consolidated volume of roughly 1.3 million shares.
Among Conrail puts, the January 95 traded 2,000 contracts and the January 100 traded about 2,175.
Elsewhere, a couple of WorldCom Inc options continued to see heavy trading on the Pacific Stock Exchange.
The WorldCom January 25 call traded about 5,100 contracts and the January 22-1/2 call traded 3,920.
Traders said increased takeover speculation on WorldCom led to a runup in call activity as well as a spike in volatility.
But they noted that the stock was not confirming the takeover speculation by rallying. WorldCom shares were up 1/4 at 22-3/8 Friday afternoon. Volume was heavy at nearly nine million shares.
